response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1¾ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup buttermilk, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla, and 1 cup hot water. Whisk until smooth. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined—no overmixing. The batter will be slightly lumpy.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Place in the oven and bake for 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare a simple chocolate ganache: heat 1 cup heavy cream until steaming, pour over 8 oz chopped dark chocolate in a bowl. Stir until smooth, then let sit 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Set aside to cool to spreadable consistency.",
  "step5": "Remove cakes from pans and level tops with a knife. Place one layer on a serving plate, spread a thin layer of ganache. Top with second layer, then cover the entire cake with the remaining ganache, smoothing edges with a spatula. Chill for 15 minutes to set.",
  "step6": "Optional: Decorate with chocolate shavings, fresh berries, or a dusting of powdered sugar. Slice, serve, and enjoy a moist, rich chocolate cake perfect for 8 guests."
}
